str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Compound of heros and eidos; heroic; Herod, the name of four Jewish kings.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
An army, detachment of troops. From strateuomai; an armament, i.e. a body of troops.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To set at naught, ignore, despise. A variation of exoudenoo and meaning the same.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To mock, ridicule. From en and paizo; to jeer at, i.e. Deride.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From peri and ballo; to throw all around, i.e. Invest.
From the same as lampas; radiant; by analogy, limpid; figuratively, magnificent or sumptuous.
Clothing, raiment, vestment, robe. From hennumi; dress.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To send up (to a higher tribunal), send back. From ana and pempo; to send up or back.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Pilate. Of Latin origin; close-pressed, i.e. Firm; Pilatus, a Roman.
